page.title: 12Sandridgebury Farm & Stables
page.content: Sandridgebury stables are combined livery stables and a riding school. People with their own horses can keep their animals in the livery stables but have to help in looking after them. The stable girls feed and let out the animals in the morning and the owners come every evening to feed, groom and exercise them. There are 25 stable liveries and 8 grass liveries. Barnaby is 15 hands and the smallest horse Percy is 11\ hands. The oldest horse is 36 years old and the youngest is 4\ years old. 75% of the riding school pupils are children aged 5 to 16. On sunny days they get 100 riders on average. The busiest days are Saturdays and Sundays. The lessons are Â£4.50 per hour and are from 7.30am to 6.00pm.The riding school employs 5 helpers.
